name: market for hard coal | hard coal | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18329/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'hard coal', in the geography of India.;The activity represents transport of hard coal (after preparation activity) Average Transport distance specific for the country has been used. Handling and Transit Losses has been used in the dataset.   ;The major modes of transport of hard coal after preparation activity is railways.The major modes of transport of coal in India are Railways. Road (use of lorries) is used for transportation of coal from preparation plant to nearest station and then from receiving station to user facility.;hard coal' is a fossil fuel with a calorific value of 27.91 MJ/kg. It is used as a solid fuel and is sourced from coal mines after crushing, screening and washing the coal. Its main applications are in the following sectors: domestic fuel (mainly for hand-fired stoves), as filter media and as an ingredient in charcoal briquettes.

The activity starts with 1 kg hard coal at hard coal preparation plant ready to be shiped to consumers.

This module includes transport of hard coal from coal preparation plant to various industries Losses are included.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/05:Mining of coal and lignite/051:Mining of hard coal/0510:Mining of hard coal

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Average distance calculated between mines and their dispacth location.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This activity represents transport of hard coal from coal preparation plant to various users in the country. The major modes of transport of coal in India are Railways. Road (use of lorries) is used for transportation of coal from preparation plant to nearest station and then from receiving station to user facility.

flow.name: hard coal
flow.category: B:Mining and quarrying/05:Mining of coal and lignite/051:Mining of hard coal/0510:Mining of hard coal

exchanges.description: Literature data: Taken from Coal Sewa App by Coal India Limited. The mode wise despatch is given all major subsidiaries in the country. The avergae distance were then calculated between the despatch point and respective company.Following link can be used further to extract information: http://elib.cmpdi.co.in/SEVA/

exchanges.description:
Assumption by Dones et al.: per one time of unloading from transport mode, (storing) and loading on subsequent transport mode an average demand (electric) energy of 7.2 kWh/tonne and an average land use demand of 1m2*a/tonne is required.
Reference(s):
Dones, R., Bauer, C., Röder, A. (2007) Kohle. In: Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. Final report ecoinvent No. 6-VI, Paul Scherrer Institut Villigen, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.

Own Assumption: This value is assumed for transport of coal from preparation plant to nearest dispatch railway station and receiving station to the consumer facility. The distance from preparation plant to dispatch station is considered 25 km and distance from receiving station to consumer facility is also considered 25 km.
